Name: Stela of Senwosret
Description: In the lunette of this tall rectangular stela is a jackal on a standard. Below this are two rows of text containing the offering formula. The upper register depicts a couple on the left, facing a small offering table. In front of them is a man with an incense burner in his hand. Then there is another row of hieroglyphs. The lower register shows another couple seated in front of an altar. Facing them are two men, one holding a lotus flower and a hes-vase, the other is an offering bearer with geese. The stela still shows traces of paint.
